author: Joshua Taylor
title: Mum defends decision to share heartbreaking photographs of the 16 days she spent with her dead baby
text:
News Mum defends decision to share heartbreaking photographs of the 16 days she spent with her dead baby Charlotte Szakacs has hit back at those who have reacted negatively to her sharing the images to help raise awareness of support available for grieving parents Share Charlotte Szakacs and husband Attila got to spend an extra 16 days with their first child thanks to a 'cuddle cot' (Photo: Mercury Press and Media Ltd) Share Get daily   
A mum who shared heartbreaking photos of the 16 days she spent with her dead baby girl has hit back at online trolls. 
Brave Charlotte Szakacs, 21, and her husband Attila, 28, lost their baby Evlyn a month after she was born, but were able to spend more than two weeks with her body before her funeral. 
The couple took their dead baby girl home and for walks in a pram - keeping a photographic diary of the precious time they spent with her. 
Charlotte is now planning to get Evlyn's tiny hand and footprints tattooed onto her body, along with roses and writing, as a tribute. 
But the tragic mum drew the attention of online trolls as she shared her moving story and photos on a Facebook page called Evlyn's Story . Charlotte took baby Evlyn's body for walks in the park (Photo: Mercury Press and Media Ltd) Charlotte and Attila spent four weeks with their baby girl before her death (Photo: Mercury Press and Media Ltd) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 'CuddleCot' that lets grieving families say a final goodbye Share this video Watch Next 
Hitting back, Charlotte wrote: "So I just want to say to the negative people, if you don't like seeing photos of my daughter then don't follow her page, simple. 
"I made this page so people can follow her journey and make awareness of real stuff that happens in the world that you never hear about, so I will keep posting her journey. 
"I carried her for 37 weeks, I gave birth to her, I sat by her side for four weeks in the neonatal intensive care unit whilst she was fighting very hard for her life, she lost her battle, I've lost a baby, everything we wanted and loved in our life has gone and now I'm allowed to make memories with her and I'm going to post it as part as her journey. Evlyn bravely fought for her life, but tragically died at just four weeks of age (Photo: Mercury Press and Media Ltd) Charlotte and her husband spent a year trying for a baby (Photo: Mercury Press and Media Ltd) Read More Mum who spent 16 days with dead baby girl was behaving "totally normally" says expert who claims "some parents spend a MONTH" 
"Until you've been in our position you'll never know how it feels to lose your child, imagining it isn't even half of the pain." 
And she added: "But thank you to all of my lovely followers and supporters, you are all amazing." 
The York couple's heartbreaking story has been met with an outpouring of sympathy on social media . 
Evlyn was born on December 13 at Leeds General Infirmary, weighing 5lbs 5oz with an underdeveloped brain which was completely smooth, narrow airways in her nose and lungs and a defective aorta. 
This was due to a debilitating chromosome abnormality that first showed up on her 20-week scan in September 2016. 
And despite battling against the odds for four weeks after being born, the tot passed away in her parents' arms on January 10. The couple say spending time with Evlyn's body helped them grieve (Photo: Mercury Press and Media Ltd) Read More ''I've had enough of my life'': Teenage girl hanged herself after being sexually assaulted 
Evlyn's body remained in the hospice for 12 days in a 'cuddle cot' that preserved her and allowed her parents to spend time with her. 
And for four final days before her funeral on January 26, Charlotte and Attila got to take their daughter home - a joy the first-time parents had otherwise lost thanks to Evlyn's cruel illness. 
Charlotte and Attila, who married in 2015, had been trying for a baby for more than a year when they found out they were expecting the day before Charlotte's 21st birthday on April 29. 
Charlotte realised a lot of people were unaware that the 'cuddle cot' option was there for grieving parents and she decided to share her story to raise awareness. Like us on Facebook
